contextId.information: They are to obey what God's word commands.  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Controlling one's tongue stands for controlling one's speech. AT: "what he says" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This means either "have enough clothes to wear" or "have a place to sleep." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
to eat, to wear, and to live comfortably (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The word "see" is a metonym. AT: "understand" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

The tongue is a metonym for what people say. James calls it a fire because of the great damage it can do. AT: "The tongue is like a fire" or "What people say can cause serious problems just as a fire can" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and  [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: The tongue is also a fire

contextId.information: James speaks of the tongue as if it were a wild animal. Here "tongue" represents a person's desire to speak evil thoughts. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: But as for the tongue, no one among man is able to tame it

contextId.information: The word "heart" refers to emotions or thoughts. AT: "strongly desire what other people own and experience, and you seek your own interests regardless of other people's interests" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: have bitter jealousy and ambition in your heart

contextId.information: The word "earthly" refers to the values and behaviors of the people who do not honor God. AT: "not honoring to God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This phrase refers to identifying with or participating in the world's value system and behavior. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]]).

To be friends with the world means that one is an enemy of God. Here "friendship with the world" stands for people who are friends with the world, and "hostility against God" stands for people who are hostile against God. AT: "friends of the world are enemies of God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: friendship with the world is hostility against God

contextId.information: This expression is a command for people to do righteous acts instead of unrighteous acts. AT: "Behave in a way that honors God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
James speaks of the believers as if they are biological brothers. AT: "fellow believers" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "flesh" stands for the physical body. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

This refers to the time right before God comes to judge all people. The wicked think they are storing up riches for the future, but what they are doing is storing up judgment. AT: "for when God is about to judge you" (UDB)  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This phrase refers to the return of Jesus, when he will begin his kingdom on the earth and judge all people. AT: "until Christ's return" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
James is equating the believers' hearts to their will to remain committed. AT: "Stay committed" or "Keep your faith strong" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The words "heaven" and "earth" refer to the spiritual or human authorities that are in heaven and earth. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: either by heaven or by the earth

contextId.information: Here "fruit" stands for all the crops of the farmers.  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
